alert.note: Alert for Rains; Van Zandt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 1:57AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Van Zandt and southern Rains Counties through 245 AM CST... At 157 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Tawakoni State Park to Purtis Creek State Park. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Canton, Wills Point, Edgewood, Purtis Creek State Park, and Lake Tawakoni around 200 AM CST. Fruitvale around 205 AM CST. Grand Saline around 215 AM CST. Van around 220 AM CST. Edom around 225 AM CST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Ben Wheeler, Whitton, Alsa, Phalba, Roddy, Jackson, Oakland, Wise, Walton, and Myrtle Springs. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 514 and 542. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for north central Texas.
